com.facebook.concurrency

Interface ConcurrentCache<K,V,E extends Exception>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - key to use in the cache
    V - value of the cache
    E - exception that may be thrown when creating the value for the cache
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Map.Entry<K,CallableSnapshot<V,E>>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreConcurrentCache, ExpiringConcurrentCache

    public interface ConcurrentCache<K,V,E extends Exception>
extends Iterable<Map.Entry<K,CallableSnapshot<V,E>>>
    Subset of Map relevant to doing caching. Provides an iterator that allows removal of entries from the cache

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Unconditional clear operation on the cache
      V get(K key)
      Returns a value associated with the specified key, creating a new value if no previous mapping existed.
      CallableSnapshot<V,E> getIfPresent(K key)
      This checks if there is a cached result associated with the key.
      void prune()
      Optionally may apply heuristic to prune the cache.
      V put(K key, V value)
      atomic insert that will replace any existing value
      V remove(K key)
      Removes the specified key from the cache, and returns the associated result, which may either be a return value or a value creation exception.
      boolean removeIfError(K key)
      Removes the key if the cached result is an exception
      int size() 

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        iterator

    • Method Detail

      • get

        V get(K key)
      throws E extends Exception
        Returns a value associated with the specified key, creating a new value if no previous mapping existed. NOTE: on exception, the exception will be cached as the result for all future gets(...) on this key until this key is explicitly cleared with a call to remove(...) or removeIfError(...).
        Parameters:
        key - - key to use in the cache
        Returns:
        - returns the value in the cache for the specified key, creating a new value if one did not previously exist
        Throws:
        E - - user specified value creation exception
        E extends Exception

      • put

        V put(K key,
    V value)
      throws E extends Exception
        atomic insert that will replace any existing value
        Parameters:
        key -
        value -
        Returns:
        existing value for key, or null if none is present
        Throws:
        E
        E extends Exception

      • remove

        V remove(K key)
         throws E extends Exception
        Removes the specified key from the cache, and returns the associated result, which may either be a return value or a value creation exception.
        Parameters:
        key - - key to remove from the cache
        Returns:
        removed entry, null if not present
        Throws:
        E - - may throw a creation exception if the create failed, but will still remove the cached result
        E extends Exception

      • removeIfError

        boolean removeIfError(K key)
        Removes the key if the cached result is an exception
        Parameters:
        key - - key to remove from the cache
        Returns:
        true iff the element was removed

      • getIfPresent

        CallableSnapshot<V,E> getIfPresent(K key)
        This checks if there is a cached result associated with the key. If so, it returns a CallableSnapshot, null otherwise
        Parameters:
        key - - key to check
        Returns:
        CallableSnapshot or null if not present

      • clear

        void clear()
        Unconditional clear operation on the cache

      • prune

        void prune()
           throws E extends Exception
        Optionally may apply heuristic to prune the cache.
        Throws:
        E extends Exception

      • size

        int size()
        Returns:
        The number of keys stored in the map
